topic.para: The installation scripts provide a quick way to set up a basic &ha; cluster that can be used for testing purposes. However, to expand this cluster into a functioning &ha; cluster that can be used in production environments, more steps are recommended:

listitem.para: Add more nodes to the cluster using the crm cluster join script.
Before using the cluster in a production environment, replace softdog with a hardware watchdog.
For critical workloads, we highly recommend having two or three &stonith; devices, using either physical &stonith; devices or disk-based &sbd;.

&qdevice; and &qnet; participate in quorum decisions. With assistance from the arbitrator &qnet;, &qdevice; provides a configurable number of votes. This allows clusters to sustain more node failures than the standard quorum rules allow. We recommend deploying &qdevice; and &qnet; in clusters with an even number of nodes, and especially in two-node clusters.
